title: Microsoft Edge: A Frustrating and Glitchy Experience**
text: Microsoft Edge aims to be a sleek, secure browser, but in reality, it often feels like an obstacle rather than an asset. Its usability issues, lack of compatibility, and frustrating authentication process make it difficult to recommend.  ### **Password Creation Issues**  Signing into a new app and creating a password should be simple, but Edge unnecessarily complicates the process. The forced reliance on Microsoft Authenticatorâ€”especially with its impending retirementâ€”makes this even worse. Users shouldnâ€™t have to jump through extra hoops just to access their accounts.  ### **Glitches & Site Incompatibilities**  Edgeâ€™s struggles extend beyond just logins. Websites like **Synapse Mobility** and **Religipax** frequently fail to load or function correctly, forcing users to troubleshoot or switch browsers entirely. Whether it's rendering problems, slow response times, or broken features, Edge feels unreliable for anything beyond casual browsing.  ### **Overall Verdict**  Rather than delivering efficiency and convenience, Microsoft Edge often feels like a frustrating puzzle that users must constantly solve. With so many alternative browsers offering smoother performance and better compatibility, itâ€™s hard to justify sticking with Edge unless forced by workplace requirements. Until Microsoft addresses these persistent issues, Edge remains more of a liability than a useful tool.

title: â€Suggestion for Enhancing the Review System on the Microsoft Store
text: Dear Microsoft Support Team,I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to propose an enhancement to the user experience on the Microsoft Store for PC applications.Currently, many users face challenges in fully expressing their opinions when writing reviews for applications and software. The limited space allocated for text input often restricts users from conveying their thoughts comprehensively.I suggest increasing the character limit for the review text field, allowing users to provide more detailed and informative feedback. This improvement would not only enhance the quality of information available to other users but also assist them in making more informed decisions when selecting applications.Thank you for considering this suggestion. I look forward to seeing future improvements in the Microsoft Store.Best regards,

However, after the latest iOS firmware beta update, both my iPhone and iPad load pages smoothlyâ€”possibly even a bit faster. I now receive an unsecured warning on local intranet sites and can proceed without any problems instead of a blank page.

title: Feels Incomplete, switched to Vivaldi
text: I do not understand the reason for a lot of the design choices for all these modern applications. Edge used to look very appealing, but now it looks very incomplete. The tab does not even connect to the menu bar, and we have a plain color gray for the header. It feels like the designers were in such a rush to get these updates out. Does this look like something you would use, yourself? I switched to Vivaldi, since I need to browse in style.

title: Lack of Support
text: I have been confronting some issues for which I have asked for help to no avail. Before I would get the assistance needed within a couple of days but now I donâ€™t get any type of response nor assistance from Microsoft.On 5/07/25 & 5/09/25 I wrote to Microsoft Edge AI Browser Support asking for help in reference to an issue that I was confronting with my email folders which had began after a recent update. Once I created a new folder these were not getting into their corresponding alphabetical order as they were supposed to but remained at the top of the folders list. Since I did not receive any response to my inquiry I wrote a two Stars Review about the malfunctioning of Edge AI Browser on the Apple Store and about their lack of support since this wasnâ€™t the first time my inquiries were ignored.On May 13, I got a response from Apple letting me know that Microsoft Edge AI Browser Developer had responded to my two stars review. They apologized for my bad experience and asked for details about the issue that I was confronting. I provided them the required information and also provided them a couple of pictures showing exactly what was the issue that I was referring to.On May 14, 2025 @ 2:18 am Edge AI Browser Support wrote asking me for some more information since they allegedly werenâ€™t sure what was the whole issue about. At 8:35 am I responded to their email providing more information about the issue and even sent them two additional more photos. At approx. 11:30 am I wrote an other email letting them know that I had been able to solve the issue on my own hence I didnâ€™t need any assistance from them.

title: Good, but needs PDF
text: Iâ€™ve appreciated the Edge browser for awhile, especially because of superior ad-blocking built in. However, it no longer supports printing to PDF and now only creates proprietary files that canâ€™t be shared outside the Microsoft ecosystem. Thatâ€™s a tremendous limit on accessibility, and is completely unrealistic as an iPhone user. Also, there should be options for custom search engines (in order to opt out of Google AI tools).

title: Good browser, but buggy update
text: Generally speaking, Iâ€™d usually give this app 5/5 stars. Useful for people who need that MS account integration. However sometime in this past week, I started experiencing a bug that causes this browser to crash within seconds of opening it. Iâ€™ve attempted force touching the app icon for the context menu, hoping I could open a normal tab or a InPrivate tab in a feeble attempt to bypass this near immediate crash. No luck. May be fixable by uninstalling and reinstalling, but Iâ€™ve been holding out for a bug fix update.I donâ€™t know specifically which update this began on, but Iâ€™ve updated at least twice since it started. Using latest iOS for my supported device, so not sure what the deal is.Itâ€™s usually a great browser. Iâ€™ve used it for well over a year with no issues. Still recommended, I just hope this issue gets ironed out.

title: Good in its current form
text: I am looking for a mobile browser that will give me the best possible desktop website format possible, including websites with embedded videos & Youtube. So far, this browser allows me to set my preference to desktop view for all websites. Full screen is an issue at times but playback and interactivity is consistently functional. My passwords are remembered throughout my visited websites even when I switch back & forth from mobile to desktop format. No odd glitches. In its current iteration, this is the best, least glitchy, and most practically customizable mobile browser.

title: Edge
text: It is MS Edge. I donâ€™t need to expand on that. Google drives everything else and I loathe its intrusiveness and selling me to advertisers, trackers and its own very special overall creepiness. I had to remove and replace it because Edge VPN was not available in my settings. VPN is the great anonymiser in the world of endless trackers and data scrapers. And Google is the biggest villain of all. Well, except maybe the FSB.
